column4: my problem is that i have installed ubuntu server on two 1TB drives that runs on raid1, and after i connected another usb drive the server wont start. when i removed the usb drive the server still dont start. i need to get information off the hard drives then i can reformat or whatever i need to do to set that up again, but first i need the data
is there anybody that can help me to get to the data on the drives?
start with what you're trying to do specifically
the server version doesn't come with a gui unless you specifically ask it to install
yes. and i do not want the gui anyway
you're trying to locate a usb 1tb drive in /media?
the server does not boot now
how long ago did you install the server?
the best thing to do is reinstall if you just installe dit and didn't make ne changes
i installed it two weeks ago and it ran fine. just friday i added the usb then all the problems started
is your usb drive still connected when you reboot? connect any external devices and reboot it
there is nothing attached to the server. only the two drives inside
message when you boot it up?
the message is that i cant find the boot drive
i haven't messed with a server iso in almost a year and only for a few days if i did
i suggest you wait for better assistance or reinstall if you didn't do much to the server
i cant reinstall before the data on the server is backed up
